info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 04 at 10:00PM PST until January 05 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING HAS BEEN DOWNGRADED TO AN ADVISORY... * WHAT...Wet snow, with accumulations of 5 to 10 inches and winds gusting as high as 40 mph over open areas. * WHERE...Southern Oregon Cascades from highway 140 north, also including portions of highways 230, 138, 150 and 58. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The Advisory is for elevations from 5000 feet and above because snow levels will fall near 5000 feet around 7 AM PST, where a snow shower could cause up to one inch of snowfall; this would mainly effect the pass at Diamond Lake. However, the primary precipitation type between 5000 feet and 5500 feet will mainly be a rain snow mix. Gusty winds * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
